div.p: Yours of the 27 letter recd yesterday. the usual time and I am glad to learn that you are all well. Yesterday I sent you by Express $120.00 which I hope will arrive safely before this year will have recd H Tallcott letter and know what she wishes me to do (that is if you can read it; which is all I can do). I have no desire to go to Sonora at present. so that I must stick to the Treasury Department as long as I can which will enable us to live and educate the children. tho away from you and them it is not half living. I have the same room and furniture I had but

and spend my evenings until 9 o clock reading which I can do without hurting my eyes I have gas in the room near the fire place and am very comfortable several young men sleep in the house and sometimes I sit with them my expenses are now about $10 per week. I have not yet got my commission from Washington but expect it daily. then my pay will be better ($6,00 per day and expenses not gracitis. I hope to be able to send you all some presents for xmas and will if I can I may see you before that time but everything is unsettled and will be for some time at least until Hood and Beauregard leave Lennissu which by last nights arrival I hope will be soon. The lines here are closed and no business done at which times I cannot make

any extras I have had a present of a coat and two pairs Boots, and a promise of a dress for you. Segars and tobacco aswere my only expenses except board and washing is one glass of Lager per day. I do not think I can send you more money untill Jany. but will if I get it. I recd a letter from Haley a few days since give her my love and say I will answer it as soon as I can - I do think that the girls might write me now and then without being so punctilious as to my answering them. sitting the desk from 9 till 4 PM. I get tired of pen and ink. tell my boy that his pa does want to see him and mama very very much Give my love to the children
